trans-unit.source: Defines a type of text content in which measuring, hit testing and drawing of the entire content is done in whole.
An example of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextEmbeddedObject> is a button in the middle of a line of text.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextEmbeddedObject"></xref> class.
Gets the line breaking condition after the text object.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.LineBreakCondition"></xref>.
Gets the line breaking condition before the text object.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Windows.LineBreakCondition"></xref>.
Gets the computed bounding box of the text object.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that determines if the text object is drawn from right to left.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that determines if the text object is drawn with its side parallel to the baseline.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> value that represents the bounding box size of the text object.
Draws the text object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> to use for rendering the text object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> value that represents the origin where the text object is drawn.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that determines if the text object is drawn from right to left.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that determines if the text object is drawn with its side parallel to the baseline.
Get text object measurement metrics that will fit within the specified remaining width of the paragraph.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the remaining paragraph width.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextEmbeddedObjectMetrics"></xref> value that represents the text object metrics.
Determines whether the text object has a fixed size regardless of where it is placed within a line.
`true` if the text object has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
